author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...DISTURBANCE HAS BECOME A LITTLE BETTER ORGANIZED... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A TROPICAL STORM AND PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN CUBA AND THE BAHAMAS...
summary: ...DISTURBANCE HAS BECOME A LITTLE BETTER ORGANIZED... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A TROPICAL STORM AND PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN CUBA AND THE BAHAMAS... As of 5:00 AM EDT Sat Sep 27 the center of Nine was located near 21.9, -75.8 with movement NW at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...DISTURBANCE HAS BECOME A LITTLE BETTER ORGANIZED... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A TROPICAL STORM AND PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN CUBA AND THE BAHAMAS... As of 5:00 AM EDT Sat Sep 27 the center of Nine was located near 21.9, -75.8 with movement NW at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

title: Summary - Potential Tropical Cyclone Nine (AT4/AL092025)
